history.content:
If you Google these problems, you'll find their full description:

  • Ways to Cover a Distance
  • Longest Path In Matrix
  • Subset Sum Problem
  • Optimal Strategy for a Game
  • Boolean Parenthesization Problem
  • Shortest Common Supersequence
  • Matrix Chain Multiplication
  • Partition problem
  • Rod Cutting
  • Coin change problem
  • Word Break Problem
  • Maximal Product when Cutting Rope
  • Dice Throw Problem
  • Box Stacking
  • Egg Dropping Puzzle

These are all problems that can be solved using dynamic programming.

I'll post the next homework on RSA soon if you're ready.  There are some quizzes in the videos and there are additional problems at the end of the relevant chapter of [DPV].  It's always good to do as many of the problems from [DPV] as you can, I'm stressing it more for DP because I want to make sure everyone in this class masters DP (and it usually requires lots of practice).  --Eric

Can we get some more suggested practice problems for future homework assignments(maybe the next one or two) along the lines of the practice problems given for chapter 6?

I see that there is one problem suggested from Ch 3 about identifying cycles.


-edit-

Sorry, to clarify, suggested questions for other topics such as primality or divide & conquer. Chapter 1 has a series of questions which call for proofs (i.e. prove the sum of 3 single digit numbers for any base results in a number which is two digits in length). Are these part of the course material? If no then is there a list of suggested questions from Ch1 or Ch3?
history.subject: Suggested Practice Problems
